Drafted April 27,
Stockholm
1959
Transcribed April 30, 1959
Department of Radio and
Television Broadcasting
University of Minnesota
Toi Keith Engar
William Harley --
Harry J. Skornia
From s Burton Paulu
Paris was fine; Stockholm is fin© too*
As I have already reported, we are now quite heavily
committed to give to and take from UHI. Mme. Druon of RTF
will forward the documents to Keith, who will have to start
the ball rolling, and keep it rolling until I return in
September.
Now, about Stockholm. The most interesting development
so far took place this morning. The (Italian) chairman
observed that American stations had not taken many television
programs from European sources. Romney Wheeler of USIA
thereupon recommended the acceptance of the ETBC's pending
EBU membership application, which had been stalled due to
constitutional and legalistic problems. He urged that it be
approved, and read from a letter to him by Jack White so
stating. The EBU secretary reported that now only action by
the proper EBU body (administrative assembly?—not the present
group, anyhow) remained to be done.
Sig Mickleson of CBS, who is here with three of his
European staff (Olympics, live programs when transatlantic
television is technically feasible), also supported the ETRC
request. Sig said this would give an outlet to European
programs which commercial television1s crowded schedules do
not permit.
I thereupon supported the ETHC,s request too, even in
the absence of instructions from you. Why? Because I think
we cannot be a dog-in-the-manger here; because I think they
will get it anyway; because I think it is to American
educational television^ overall advantage for them to
belong; and because I think NAEB*s opposing it would put us
into an impossible strategic position.
You can disassociate yourselves from me if you wish.
But if you support me, I think someone of you should drop a
note to Jack 'White reporting that I did support their
application, and wishing them luck! We donft want Wheeler
or anyone els© misreportlng that I either opposed it or
dragged my feet!
